intro: Sophia californica, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to reddish-orange petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides. Its flowers bloom in the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The California poppy is also recognized as the state flower of California.
